Title:
A new species of Xenasmatella (Polyporales, Basidiomycota) on
rotten bamboo from southern China
Abstract:
A new wood-inhabiting fungus in the order Polyporales,
Xenasmatella xxx sp. nov., is described and illustrated from China based
on morphological and molecular evidence. The species was collected in
Yunnan Province, where it grew on the undersides of a rotten bamboo. X.
xxx is characterized by annual, resupinate basidioma with a pinkish buff
hymenophore, a monomitic hyphal system, generative hyphae thin-walled
with clamp connections, presence of voluminous crystalline masses
between hyphal layer, absence of cystidia and cystidioles, and broadly
ellipsoid to subglobose basidiospores measuring 3.85 × 3.34 μm. The
phylogenetic analysis based on the nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS) dataset
shows that the new species belongs to Xenasmatella. The difference
between X. xxx and other members of the genus are discussed. In
addition, two new combinations, X. gossypina and X. wuliangshanensis,
are also proposed.
